recurrent_expenditure_actual.notes: Highest scoring candidate with 'Actual' data type, strong table evidence, and clear unit. Forms a coherent starting point for the time series. Critic confidence: 0.9, Verification confidence: 0.95

Highest scoring candidate with 'Actual' data type and strong table evidence. Value (85,000 million GHS) represents a plausible 21.4% growth from 2020, maintaining time series coherence. Critic confidence: 0.9, Verification confidence: 0.95. Growth rate of 21.4% from 2020 is on the higher side but not implausible given potential economic factors. [AUTO-FIX 2025-11-02: REVERTED - Original value 85,000 was correct, not 10x error. Value restored from incorrect /10 fix.]

Highest scoring candidate with 'Actual' data type and very strong table evidence. Value (105,000 million GHS) shows a coherent 23.5% growth from 2021. Critic confidence: 0.95, Verification confidence: 0.95. Growth rate of 23.5% from 2021 is on the higher side but not implausible given potential economic factors.

Highest scoring candidate with 'Actual' data type and strong table evidence. Value (130,000 million GHS) maintains time series coherence with 23.8% growth from 2022. Critic confidence: 0.9, Verification confidence: 0.95. Growth rate of 23.8% from 2022 is on the higher side but not implausible given potential economic factors.

Chosen as the best available candidate with an acceptable data type ('Revised estimate' for 'actual' indicator) that maintains time series coherence. Value (160,000 million GHS) shows a plausible 23.1% growth from 2023. Rejected candidates either had wrong data type or an implausibly low value. Critic confidence: 0.85, Verification confidence: 0.9. Chosen candidate is 'Revised estimate' as no 'Actual' data was found for this year, reducing confidence slightly. Growth rate of 23.1% from 2023 is on the higher side but not implausible given potential economic factors.
